item.description:
The Wind That Shakes The Barley will screen at 7 pm.

This historical drama, directed by Ken Loach and set in the 1920's depicts two brothers alternating views and actions as Ireland fights to become independent from British rule. Winner of the Palme d'Or at the 2006 Cannes Film Festival and highly acclaimed, this film (from what I've read) may lack the intimacy of Loach's more immediate works, which have dealt directly with British contemporary social injustices. Nonetheless, this film should spark some interesting dialogue afterward.

Here is a complete review: http://nymag.com/movi...

Tom will be holding a meetup sign near the front row after the movie and then its off to the local Irish restaurant/pub Tommy Doyle's to discuss. Probably best if no one orders a "Black and Tan".
item.name: The Wind That Shakes The Barley
